column2: but kicked up a notch and a half. There is something resembling most of your diner favorites on the menu
column4: and be... elevated. You'll also see things nothing like what you'd see in a normal diner. I've been here a few times and always tried something different
column5: and I've never been disappointed. Some faves are the Los Drowned (very messy
column6: and watch out for some pieces of fat)
column7: the BBQ Pork and Tonkatsu. The sandwiches are generally large
column8: but word of warning: they are a la carte. The smoked fries are pricey at $7
column9: but they are enough for at least two people. In true diner fashion
column10: you can order breakfast all day.
